Articles.Content:
Note: I've searched the forums for this first, but I'm sure I probably missed it somewhere.

I've got a question for all you long-haul boomers out there: How much dV does it take to go from Kerbin to other planets? I'm really interested in the Kerbin-Duna window right now, but if you have other Hohmann tranfer requirements, I'll gladly take those.

The reason I ask is because I'm trying to do planetary transfers with the smallest possible ships, without resorting to the ion engines or addon parts. (I make an exception for guidance parts like MechJeb, Engineer, and protractor.)

Edited August 4, 2013 by MaverickSawyer
Question answered

I always use this thing for doing transfers to planets

http://ksp.olex.biz/

gives you pretty much everything you need, dV, angles and stuff

hope this thing helps

Here is a good map that was created a while back (dont remember Author), it is a very helpful guide, but it does not make up for human error.... Like when I overshoot Moho and burned 3k Dv to get back into orbit.

For inspiration on craft design check this out :

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/36419-Smallest-Craft-to-Various-Milestones
Thank you all for the prompt feedback. My Duna exploration mission can now enter full scale planning in the VAB.

this is also a good web tool too

http://alexmoon.github.io/ksp/
